WRITING.TITLE: So how accurate are those "alcohol screening tests"? Bullshit, or actually a good indicator?
WRITING.TEXT: Would ask r/stopdrinking but they would be way too biased. I think they're bullshit.
Cheers to that. Judge not, lest yea be judged yourself. John the Fuck, verse 21

Are you asking how to tell if someone else is blacked out or if you're blacked out?
Cause if it signs that you are blacked out, and I think that's what your asking, it might be too late to tell. For me, at least, it's fine, fine, what the hell, how did it get to be 7am.
also if you need inspiration r/veg is fantastic

Rice is dirt cheap, and if you get brown rice it'll be better than processed carbs, nutritionally speaking. also it's extremely versatile. I make a stir fry with brown rice, tofu, beans, eggs and random veggies about once a week, pop in in the fridge, and have leftovers for a week.
this is a good starting recipe but there is a ton of room for improv and substitution. also this recipe leaves out soy sauce but it's a wonderful addition. http://www.theveggietable.com/recipes/friedrice.html
...so where can i get this? ive got a horse and small children to scare

WRITING.TITLE: Just rented a house that was built in 1975 and hasn't changed since. Not furnished. What to do?
WRITING.TEXT: Think everything carpeted(not shag, thank goodness) and dark wood paneling literally EVERYWHERE(including the bathroom). I apologize that I don't have any pictures. The whole house is very dark, with very little built in light. However, it does have alot of space, including a huge finished basement and a large living room.we are allowed to paint. What can I do to make the place feel less dated and more airy? We plan on doing alot of entertaining. Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: I'm moving out on my own and am building my kitchen from nothing. What essentials do I need?
WRITING.TEXT:
Knives, utensils, spices, pots, anything and everything I need to make a working kitchen. What do I need?
edit:i do alot of stir fries and vegetarian cooking. also lots of baking. budget: 300 bucks, give or take

picobong or lelo anything. the kiki(picobong) and the lily(lelo) are two smaller, non terrifying not super big with 10 attachments vibrators. and they have a ton of different settings so you can pick which level fits you. they're alittle expensive, but it will be well worth it.
